lines.content: **Your personal digital task manager with a smile!** >.<
GiggleBytes is a desktop application that helps you track and manage your tasks efficiently.
It combines the speed of a command-line interface with the friendliness of a graphical user interface.
1. **Ensure you have Java 17 or later installed**.
2. **Download the latest `gigglebytes.jar`** from your repository‚Äôs releases page.
3. **Copy the JAR file** into an empty folder (recommended).
4. **Open a terminal/command prompt** in that folder.
6. **Start typing commands!** See the features below to get started.
> üí° **Tip:** The GUI version will open automatically.
Adds a simple todo task with no date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a deadline (due date/time).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Adds an event with a start and end time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks in your list with their numbers and status.
Searches for tasks containing a specific keyword (case-insensitive).
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Sorts tasks by various criteria to help you organise your list.
| `status` | Undone tasks first, then done tasks |
| `type` | Grouped by task type (Deadline, Event, Todo) |
Add `reverse` to sort in descending order.
Nice! >.< I've marked this task as done:
Marks a completed task as not done.
OK ;-; , I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task from your list permanently.
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
Saves your tasks and exits the application.
Byte you later! Hope to see you again soon! >.<
üí° Tip: Your tasks are automatically saved when you exit.
A: Tasks are saved in a file called `gigglebytes.txt` in the `data` folder (created automatically in the same directory as the JAR file).
**Q: Can I use the app without the GUI?**
A: Yes. The app works in both GUI and CLI modes.
A: Examples include `2024-12-31 2359`, `Friday 5pm`, or `tomorrow` (depending on your date parser).
**Q: Can I edit a task after creating it?**
A: Currently, delete and re-add to edit.
**Q: Is there a limit to how many tasks I can have?**
A: GiggleBytes can handle up to 100 tasks efficiently for most use-cases.
Solution: Ensure you have Java 17 or later installed:
Solution: Ensure the app has write permissions in the folder you placed the JAR in (it needs to create a `data` folder).
Solution: Ensure JavaFX dependencies are correctly included (your packaged app should include them).
Solution: Check your spelling and format. Commands are case-insensitive.
**Your personal digital task manager with a smile!** >.<
GiggleBytes is a desktop application that helps you track and manage your tasks efficiently.
It combines the speed of a command-line interface with the friendliness of a graphical user interface.
1. **Ensure you have Java 17 or later installed**.
2. **Download the latest `gigglebytes.jar`** from your repository‚Äôs releases page.
3. **Copy the JAR file** into an empty folder (recommended).
4. **Open a terminal/command prompt** in that folder.
6. **Start typing commands!** See the features below to get started.
> üí° **Tip:** The GUI version will open automatically.
Adds a simple todo task with no date/time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Adds a task with a deadline (due date/time).
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Adds an event with a start and end time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
Displays all tasks in your list with their numbers and status.
Searches for tasks containing a specific keyword (case-insensitive).
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Sorts tasks by various criteria to help you organise your list.
| `status` | Undone tasks first, then done tasks |
| `type` | Grouped by task type (Deadline, Event, Todo) |
Add `reverse` to sort in descending order.
Nice! >.< I've marked this task as done:
Marks a completed task as not done.
OK ;-; , I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a task from your list permanently.
Now you have 6 tasks in the list.
Saves your tasks and exits the application.
Byte you later! Hope to see you again soon! >.<
üí° Tip: Your tasks are automatically saved when you exit.
A: Tasks are saved in a file called `gigglebytes.txt` in the `data` folder (created automatically in the same directory as the JAR file).
**Q: Can I use the app without the GUI?**
A: Yes. The app works in both GUI and CLI modes.
A: Examples include `2024-12-31 2359`, `Friday 5pm`, or `tomorrow` (depending on your date parser).
**Q: Can I edit a task after creating it?**
A: Currently, delete and re-add to edit.
**Q: Is there a limit to how many tasks I can have?**
A: GiggleBytes can handle up to 100 tasks efficiently for most use-cases.
Solution: Ensure you have Java 17 or later installed:
Solution: Ensure the app has write permissions in the folder you placed the JAR in (it needs to create a `data` folder).
Solution: Ensure JavaFX dependencies are correctly included (your packaged app should include them).
Solution: Check your spelling and format. Commands are case-insensitive.

* Handles all user interface interactions for the GiggleBytes application.
* This class is responsible for displaying messages to the user,
* reading user input, and managing the command-line interface.
* Constructs a new Ui instance with a Scanner for user input.
* Displays the welcome message and application logo.
* Also shows available commands to help the user get started.
System.out.println("Hello! o/ I'm GiggleBytes! Your personal digital task manager!");
System.out.println("I can help you track and complete your tasks! >.<");
* Displays a help message showing all available commands.
System.out.println("  - Sort tasks: Type 'sort [date|description|status|type]' (add 'reverse' for descending)");
System.out.println("  - Mark task as done: Type 'mark [number]'");
System.out.println("  - Mark task as not done: Type 'unmark [number]'");

* Should be called when the application is exiting.

public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws GiggleBytesException;

* Represents a deadline task with a due date/time.
* A deadline has a description and a "by" date/time when it must be completed.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description and due date/time.
* @param description The description of the deadline
* @param by The due date/time in string format
assert by != null : "Deadline 'by' date cannot be null";
* Returns the due date/time of this deadline.
assert by != null : "By date should never be null after construction";
* Returns the type icon for deadline tasks.
* Returns the display string representation of the deadline.
* @return The display string for the deadline
assert by != null : "By date should not be null when displaying";
* Represents an event task with a start and end date/time.
* An event has a description, a start time ("from"), and an end time ("to").
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, start, and end times.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param from The start date/time in string format
* @param to The end date/time in string format
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
assert from != null : "Event 'from' date cannot be null";
assert to != null : "Event 'to' date cannot be null";
assert !from.equals(to) : "Event start and end times should be different";
* Returns the start date/time of this event.
assert from != null : "From date should never be null after construction";
* Returns the end date/time of this event.
assert to != null : "To date should never be null after construction";
* Returns the type icon for event tasks.
* Returns the display string representation of the event.
* @return The display string for the event
assert from != null && to != null : "Both from and to dates should exist when displaying";
* Represents a task in the GiggleBytes application.
* This is an abstract base class for all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Each task has a description and a completion status.
public abstract class Task implements Displayable {
* Constructs a new Task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the task
assert description != null : "Task description cannot be null";
* Returns the description of the task.
assert description != null : "Description should never be null after construction";
* Returns whether the task is done.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
assert !isDone : "Task should not be already done when marking as done";
* Marks the task as not done.
assert isDone : "Task should be done when marking as not done";
* Attempts to mark the task as done and returns appropriate message.
* @return Message indicating result of the operation
* Attempts to mark the task as not done and returns appropriate message.
* @return Message indicating result of the operation
* Returns the status icon for display purposes.
* [X] for done tasks, [ ] for not done tasks.
* Returns the type icon for this task.
* Returns the display string representation of the task.
* @return The display string for the task
assert getTypeIcon() != null : "Type icon cannot be null";
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task
* Represents a todo task with only a description.
* A todo is the simplest type of task with no date/time associated.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the given description.
* @param description The description of the todo
* Returns the type icon for todo tasks.

* Creates a dialog box for GiggleBytes messages.
* Image on left, text on right (left-aligned)
public static DialogBox getGiggleBytesDialog(String text, Image img) {

* Shows the welcome message when the application starts.
String welcome = "Hello! o/ I'm GiggleBytes! Your personal digital task manager!\n"
+ "I can help you track and complete your tasks! >.<\n\n"
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing GiggleBytes' reply
* and then appends them to the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Represents an object that can be displayed in the user interface.
* Classes implementing this interface provide a string representation
* suitable for display to the user.
* Returns a string representation of the object suitable for display.
* An abstract base class for collections of Displayable objects.
* Provides basic operations for managing and displaying a collection
* of items that implement the Displayable interface.
* Constructs a new DisplayableCollection with the specified maximum capacity.
* @param maxCapacity The maximum number of items the collection can hold
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
assert items != null : "Items list should be initialized";
assert itemCount == 0 : "Item count should start at 0";
* Returns the number of items in the collection.
assert itemCount >= 0 : "Item count cannot be negative";
assert itemCount <= items.size() : "Item count cannot exceed list size";
* Returns the item at the specified position in the collection.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first item is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the item to retrieve
* @return The item at the specified index, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) != null : "Items at valid indices should not be null";
* Prints all items in the collection to standard output.
* If the collection is empty, displays an appropriate message.
* Otherwise, displays each item with its position number.
System.out.println("Your list is empty! Add something first!");
assert itemCount > 0 : "Item count should be positive when printing non-empty list";
assert items.get(i) != null : "All items in collection should be non-null";
* Removes and returns the item at the specified position in the collection.
* Positions are 1-indexed (first item is at position 1).
* @param index The 1-based index of the item to remove
* @return The removed item, or null if the index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) != null : "Item to remove should not be null";
assert itemCount == oldCount - 1 : "Item count should decrease by 1 after removal";
* Constants for user-facing messages throughout the application.
public static final String TODO_EMPTY = "Oopsies! The description of a todo cannot be empty. ;-;";

public static final String TASK_ADDED = "Got it. I've added this task:";
public static final String TASK_REMOVED = "Noted! I've removed this task:";
public static final String TASK_COUNT = "Now you have %d tasks in the list.";
public static final String MARK_DONE = "Nice! >.< I've marked this task as done:";
public static final String MARK_NOT_DONE = "OK ;-; , I've marked this task as not done yet:";
public static final String ALREADY_DONE = "This task was already marked as done!  0-0";
public static final String ALREADY_NOT_DONE = "This task was already marked as not done! <.<";
public static final String GOODBYE = "Byte you later! Hope to see you again soon! >.<";
public static final String TASKS_COMPLETED = "Tasks completed today: %d >.<";
public static final String LOADED_TASKS = "Loaded %d tasks from save file! >.<";
public static final String NO_SAVED_DATA = "No saved data found. Starting fresh! >.<";
public static final String SORTED = "Tasks sorted by %s!";

public static final String MATCHING_TASKS = "Here are the matching tasks in your list:";

* Manages a collection of tasks in the GiggleBytes application.
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
assert maxCapacity > 0 : "Max capacity must be positive";
assert loadedTasks != null : "Loaded tasks list cannot be null";
assert itemCount == loadedTasks.size() : "Item count should match loaded tasks size";
assert description != null : "Todo description cannot be null";
assert getTask(itemCount).isPresent() : "Task should be added successfully";
public boolean addDeadline(String description, String by) {
assert description != null : "Deadline description cannot be null";
assert by != null : "Deadline by date cannot be null";
assert !by.trim().isEmpty() : "Deadline by date cannot be empty";
assert added.isPresent() && added.get() instanceof Deadline : "Added task should be a Deadline";
public boolean addEvent(String description, String from, String to) {
assert description != null : "Event description cannot be null";
assert from != null : "Event from date cannot be null";
assert to != null : "Event to date cannot be null";
assert !from.trim().isEmpty() : "Event from date cannot be empty";
assert !to.trim().isEmpty() : "Event to date cannot be empty";
assert added.isPresent() && added.get() instanceof Event : "Added task should be an Event";
* Returns the task at the specified position using Optional.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to retrieve
* @return Optional containing the task, or empty if index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) instanceof Task : "Item at valid index should be a Task";
* Returns the last task in the list.
* @return Optional containing the last task, or empty if list is empty
* Removes and returns the task at the specified position using Optional.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to delete
* @return Optional containing the deleted task, or empty if index is invalid
assert items.get(index - 1) instanceof Task : "Item to delete should be a Task";
assert itemCount == oldCount - 1 : "Item count should decrease by 1 after deletion";
return Optional.ofNullable((removed instanceof Task) ? (Task) removed : null);
* Returns a string representation of all tasks.
